items.title: Council to shut down prayer hall linked to notorious preacher
items.description: The City of Canterbury Bankstown Council says the site had been approved for use as a medical centre.

items.title: Police officer wounded in Bondi terror attack released from hospital
items.description: A young police officer who was rendered blind in one eye after being shot during the Bondi terror attack is released from hospital.

items.title: How investigators pieced together the plot to target Bondi
items.description: Security camera footage captured the Bondi Beach gunmen carrying what appears to be firearms out of a south-west Sydney property on the morning of the terror attack, court documents reveal.

items.title: Activist groups flag challenge to proposed NSW protest restrictions
items.description: Three prominent protest groups flag they will launch a constitutional challenge to NSW Premier Chris Minns's new laws restricting protests in the state.

items.title: PM recommends changes to travel rules for parliamentarians' family
items.description: Under the recommendations, family of parliamentarians would be restricted to economy class flights and an allowance for three annual "Australia-wide" return trips would be scrapped.

items.title: 'This is annexation': Israel expands control over West Bank despite Trump's opposition
items.description: Despite US President Donald Trump's objections to the annexation of the West Bank, new settlement projects are still being approved. Some Israelis are excited, while Palestinians are left fearful.

items.title: Fast cars and big debts: The unravelling of Steve Cubis
items.description: Stephen Cubis hides behind a charming facade, but his former lover and friends say the career con man ruined them financially and emotionally long before he was caught up in allegations of a multi-million-dollar fraud.

items.title: It's not just the Epstein files — these other issues are splitting Trump's base
items.description: The release of the Epstein files followed some of Donald Trump's dedicated supporters launching a rare revolt against the US president. Here are six more issues that could also divide Republicans.

items.title: CommBank customers to receive $68m in refunds for incorrect bank fees
items.description: The Commonwealth Bank of Australia will refund low-income earners receiving Centrelink payments approximately $68 million in unfair fees — just over a quarter of what was charged.

items.title: Up to 1,700 jobs axed as major security firm collapses
items.description: A "significant number" of employees have been made immediately redundant as MA Security — which provides security and maintenance services to major retailers like Coles, Kmart and Amazon — enters administration.

items.title: What the weather will bring in your capital city on Christmas Day
items.description: It is just a few sleeps until Christmas Day, and the weather is promising a mixed bag for Australia's capital cities. Here is what to expect.

items.title: Severe Christmas heatwave grips WA as cyclone intensifies offshore
items.description: Perth and much of WA are enduring a severe Christmas heatwave with extreme fire danger, while Tropical Cyclone Grant intensifies offshore.

items.title: Some Ayurvedic medicines aren't safe to consume. Here's what to look for
items.description: Australia's medicine watchdog has issued another safety alert for contaminated Ayurvedic medicines. So what do consumers need to know about this multi-million-dollar industry?

items.title: World's largest warship looms near Venezuela as US warns of land attacks
items.description: The Pentagon moved the USS Gerald R Ford, the world's largest aircraft carrier, to the Caribbean last month. Now, President Donald Trump is repeating threats of imminent strikes against Venezuelan territory.

items.title: England close ranks as Noosa investigation looms
items.description: ECB managing director Rob Key will investigate reports England's recent break in Noosa resembled a "stag do" as the tourists pick up the pieces from their Ashes defeat.

items.title: The struggle — and relief — of Christmas as a newly single mum
items.description: This is my first Christmas as a single mum where I will wake up without my son in the home. I won't be watching him excitedly tear into presents. It's not easy, but there's also some relief, writes Catherine.

items.title: The 10 podcasts we couldn't stop listening to this year
items.description: Our favourite podcasts of the year include tales of art forgery, a documentary about the life of Fela Kútì and a true-crime thriller about a dead body in the ocean.

items.title: Quiz: Can you pick the real Christmas movies from these unhinged plots?
items.description: Once December rolls around, there's nothing the minor movie studios love more than getting their most unhinged Christmas tropes out of cold storage.

items.title: 'Belittling of women's tennis': New 'Battle of the Sexes' a lose-lose
items.description: Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kygrios' match marketed under the "Battle of the Sexes" banner makes a mockery of first era-defining match between Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs.

items.title: Australia names Boxing Day Ashes replacements for Cummins and Lyon
items.description: West Australian fast bowler Jhye Richardson comes into Australia's squad for the fourth Ashes Test, while Victorian off spinner Todd Murphy has been named, and is a chance to play his eighth match and first on Australian soil.

items.title: Plans to burn rare forest abandoned after man camps in tree for six nights
items.description: The WA government abandons plans to burn a parcel of forest that is home to a species of rare tree after a 70-year-old man spent six nights living in the canopy.

items.title: Trump sparks Denmark's anger by appointing US envoy to Greenland
items.description: US President Donald Trump appoints a special envoy to Greenland, drawing renewed criticism from Denmark and the territory's leader over Washington's interest in the mineral-rich Arctic island.

items.title: Mixed bag for NSW oyster growers as peak Christmas demand looms
items.description: The Christmas oyster harvest is flourishing on the NSW south coast, but further north it is a very different story as growers face the fallout of this year's record-breaking floods.

items.title: Scientists warn deadly bird flu outbreak about to become reality for Australia
items.description: The Isle of May is the epicentre of a deadly outbreak of the H5N1 bird flu strain which has spread throughout the globe. Scientists are warning Australia could be next.

items.title: Early birds get the prawns as Christmas shopping rush gets underway
items.description: Australians flock to markets, shops and stores across the country in a last-minute rush to prepare for Christmas.
